stormpoint.description: A ruined fort atop the Ebstone Crags, the closest point to The Storm on all of Tidefall. Wind-blasted stone, collapsing walls, and a cliffside tower overlook the roaring tempest below, now claimed by Storm Worshippers who turn the ruins into a shrine of blood and fanaticism.

majorPlaces.name: Stormpoint Tower
majorPlaces.description: A lone stone tower clinging to the cliff edge, its spiral staircase leading to an exposed peak where sacrifices are lashed to lightning and wind.

majorPlaces.name: Stormpoint Tower Room
majorPlaces.description: A long ground-floor corridor ending in a cramped chamber used by cultists for chanting, carving symbols, and preparing ritual victims.

majorPlaces.name: Fort Ruins
majorPlaces.description: The shattered remains of an old sea fort, with only scattered foundations left after centuries of storms and neglect.

majorPlaces.name: Ebstone Crags
majorPlaces.description: Vast, sheer cliffs of dark stone that plunge hundreds of feet into the raging sea. At night veins of blue glimmer like lightning trapped in the rock.

majorPlaces.name: Stormpoint Camp
majorPlaces.description: A ramshackle line of tents and makeshift shelters where itinerant Storm Worshippers live, pray, and await their chance to walk willingly into the Storm’s embrace.

majorPlaces.name: Sacrifice Grounds
majorPlaces.description: An open cliffside platform littered with bones, burnt ropes, blue robes, and blood-stained stones where the cult performs their rituals.

village-of-ebstone.description: A decaying frontier village near the River Ebb, once a booming mining town but now a paranoid and impoverished settlement overshadowed by the decline of its quarries and the oppressive reach of Sarnath.

majorPlaces.name: Ebstone Marketplace
majorPlaces.description: The cobbled central square of the village, now half-empty, with traders wary of outsiders and rumours spreading faster than goods.

majorPlaces.name: Golden Pick Tavern
majorPlaces.description: A once-bustling tavern now kept afloat by gossip, ale, and the sharp-tongued landlady Tabatha Greystone.

majorPlaces.name: Ebstone Bridge
majorPlaces.description: A stone bridge crossing the River Ebb at the village’s north side, the main route for barges and travellers escaping the muddy roads.

majorPlaces.name: Abandoned Alleys
majorPlaces.description: Dilapidated homes and narrow lanes occupied sporadically by squatters, storm pilgrims, or evicted families.

majorPlaces.name: Ebside Bogs
majorPlaces.description: A harsh wetland southeast of the village, avoided by locals except when desperate for shortcuts.

majorPlaces.name: Ebstone Signpost
majorPlaces.description: A weather-beaten wooden sign giving distances to the surrounding hamlets and quarries across the Ebstone Hills.

majorPlaces.name: Blackstone Quarry
majorPlaces.description: The last operational quarry near Ebstone, its output dwindling but still demanded as tithe by Sarnath.
